_header: Of my lady Margery at her good I will gin
Subjects: songs; women, praise of; women, satire directed against
_description: Fragment of a song(?) about lady Margery — four lines rhyming aaab plus burden: ‘With fyd & fy with fy’

HunRB60363.Transcription:
Off my lady margery at hur ged I wyl be gynTo rybe hyr beute bothe
                    cheke & chynTo ly on þat lade ytt were grett synShe hathe ii
                    trusses on hyr hed lyke ii mareteyles
HunRB60363.Note:
Written twice on same page by a hand of first half of the sixteenth
                    century.
HunRB60363.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 257.
